description:
Leptospira inadai serovar Lyme str. 10 is a subspecies of the bacteria Leptospira inadai, which belongs to the genus Leptospira. Leptospira are spirochete bacteria known to cause the zoonotic disease leptospirosis in humans and animals.

Leptospira inadai serovar Lyme str. 10 is a particular strain or variant of the Leptospira inadai species that was isolated from the Lyme disease-endemic region. Serovars are used to classify Leptospira species based on differences in their surface antigens.

This strain has been associated with causing leptospirosis in certain geographic areas, though its specific pathogenicity and clinical manifestations may differ from other Leptospira serovars. Further research would be needed to fully characterize the epidemiology, virulence factors, and disease associations of this particular Leptospira inadai serovar.
